lead_paragraph: Jonathan Pryce and Jerome Holder star in this feature about an elderly Jewish baker in London who ends up hiring a young black Muslim as his assistant.

headline.print_headline: Review: ‘Dough,’ a Sweet but Pat Tale of Bridging Religious and Racial Differences
headline.main: Review: ‘Dough,’ a Sweet but Pat Tale of Bridging Religious and Racial Differences

snippet: Jonathan Pryce and Jerome Holder star in this feature about an elderly Jewish baker in London who ends up hiring a young black Muslim as his assistant.
abstract: Neil Genzlinger reviews movie Dough, directed by John  Goldschmidt.
